newsitem.title: USA: Ford CFO sees steady U.S. auto market.
newsitem.headline: Ford CFO sees steady U.S. auto market.

text.p: Despite a 6.5 percent drop in Ford Motor Co's August U.S. vehicle sales, Ford chief financial officer John Devine said he believes the U.S. car and truck market is fundamentally sound.

"Our expectation is that the U.S. industry is not going to be gangbusters, but it's going to be OK," Devine said in an interview. "I think in that scenario, it's going to be the same as you've been seeing earlier this year."
He said Ford "will try to be careful" with future vehicle incentives, which will partly be determined by the strength of the market.
He said Ford's fourth quarter vehicle production plan, which is about 5.3 percent higher than the same period last year, indicates the automaker's confidence in the market.
